body:
Actually, `logits` and `log odds` refer to the same thing, namely, `log (p/(1-p))`. The issue is that for the multidimensional case, `logits` is used to loosely refer to log of probability (possibly unnormalized). So rather than changing `logits` to `log_odds` in Bernoulli, we could change the `logits` in Categorical to `log_probs` instead (that sounds similar to the `log_prob` method though) to resolve this potential confusion.

@fritzo - do you have any thoughts / preferences on the naming?
